title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic to the pan and cook for another minute until fragrant.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino Romano, Parmesan, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta.
Immediately add the hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and toss to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly pour in the egg mixture while tossing continuously to create a creamy sauce.
Add pasta water gradually if needed to achieve desired consistency.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless chicken, cut into chunks
instructions: Marinate chicken chunks in yogurt and half the tikka masala spice blend for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook marinated chicken until browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes. Set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter and saut√© onions until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add remaining tikka masala spice blend and cook for 30 seconds.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Stir in heavy cream and garam masala. Season with salt.
Return chicken to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes to heat through.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve over basmati rice.
